abstract.p: Diane Bedrin letter describes pleasures of reading her e-book (S)

block.p: Re ''Curling Up With an E-Book,'' by Robert Bolick (Op-Ed, July 7):

I was elated to see that I am not the only one enjoying my e-book. I received mine as a Mother's Day gift from my husband. Mr. Bolick was right about the various advantages of the e-book that he mentioned. But one crucial area was neglected, and that is the simplicity of getting into bed, turning out the lights, tapping on my e-book and silently reading without page turning until I am ready to fall asleep!
Re ''Curling Up With an E-Book,'' by Robert Bolick (Op-Ed, July 7):

I was elated to see that I am not the only one enjoying my e-book. I received mine as a Mother's Day gift from my husband. Mr. Bolick was right about the various advantages of the e-book that he mentioned. But one crucial area was neglected, and that is the simplicity of getting into bed, turning out the lights, tapping on my e-book and silently reading without page turning until I am ready to fall asleep!
I still buy printed books and will continue going to bookstores. But the e-book allows me to enjoy my reading in a special way.
